content: Career Asked by Gabriel ThamAsked on 19 Nov 2018Is getting a second bachelor degree worth it?I am seeing alot of skillsfuture modular courses from NTU/NUS which can stack towards a bachelor degree.Is it even worth to get a second bachelor degree through this way? For me, getting a masters is too big of a commitment financially or time wise....Modular courses seem like a more friendly pace and the financial commitment is by module so is not too big one time payment2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered 2w agoI actually think a masters in the relevant subject could be a differentiator since having a Bachelor's degree is so common in the labour market.0 comments1

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019I guess if it’s a ’21st century skill’ like data analytics or big data management etc which gives you a competitive edge and good chance of promotion then yeah.2 comments0

Gabriel Tham19 Nov 2018actually im not sure about it leh...like so many are taking these same courses, will it even benefit me if i take...wont I just be another fish competing with other fishes lol

Plus, im considering more like career switch to the "hype" industries like big data, etcLok Yang Teng20 Nov 2018hmm...i think if you're faster ones to pick up the skill, there's exclusivity and you're at comparative advantage. Maybe a few years down it'll become the norm and those without it are not really considered.
